general_advisory: Based on the above forecast farmers can now resume intercultural operations, fertilization and spraying of plant protection chemical with sticker as required. Considering the realized and anticipated rainfall, farmers are advised to complete the transplanting of paddy by 15th of August. Farmers are advised not to apply fertilizer and herbicides in rice field when there is no sufficient soil moisture. Make arrangements for draining out excess water from the field of Pulses, Maize, Groundnut and vegetables. Due to the prevailing cloudy weather associated with high humidity, regular monitoring for occurrence of insects and diseases in crops is highly recommended. Install light trap in crop fields to monitor insect population so that timely control measure can be taken. Apply Emamectin Benzoate 5% SG @ 80 g/acre by mixing with 200 liters of water to control FAW infestation in maize.

advisory: Pest Management: If leaf blast is observed in rice field, spray Tebuconazole 50% + Trifloxystrobin 25% WG (Nativo) @ 80 g/acre or Isoprothiolane 40 EC (Sultan/Fujita/Fujione) @ 300 ml/acre by mixing with 200 liters of litre of water. Repeat the spray at 7-10 days interval.

There is chance of infestation of sheath rot and sheath blight in paddy. To manage this disease spray Tebuconazole 50% + Trifloxystrobin 25% WG (Nativo) @ 80 gram/acre or Propiconazole 25% EC (Tilt/Zerox/Dhan/Bumper) @ 200ml/acre by mixing with 200 liters of water.
If BLB is observed, spray Copper oxychloride 50% WP @ 600g/acre by mixing with 200 liters of water.

Install Pheromone traps @ 8nos./acre and light trap @1no./acre to monitor and control the population of stem borer, leaf folder and rice ear eating caterpillar at 30 DAS and replace the lure after three weeks.

After receding of rain water there is chance of infestation of Swarming Caterpillar. To manage spray Profenophos 50% EC @ 400 ml/acre or Chlorpyriphos 50 % + Cypermethrin 5 % EC @ 400 -ml/acre or Lambda-cyhalothrin @ 400 -ml/acre by mixing with 200 liters of water after cessation of rain during evening hours as the pest is most active during night.

Recommended dose of Fertilizer: Apply 26 kg DAP + 10 kg MOP + 10 kg ZnSO4 in upland condition and 35 kg DAP + 13 kg MOP + 10 kg ZnSO4 per acre in medium and low land condition as basal application. In boron deficient soil apply borax@2kg/ac For further information, contact the IMD, Bhubaneswar, Tel.#0674-2596116
Make drainage channel for draining out excess rain water.

Undertake hoeing, weeding and 1st top dressing followed by earthing up at three-week stage of cotton. Apply 26 kg urea with 20 kg MOP in hybrids and 20 kg urea with 15 kg MOP in high yielding varieties as 1st top dressing.
Application of plant hormone Planofix @ 3.5 ml mixing with 15 liters of water is advisable at 30-45 days of crop stage to control flower drop and better bulb development.

Application of Neem based pesticide like Neem oil@ 600-800 ml + 200g detergent powder per acre by mixing with 200 liters of water is advisable at 30-45 days of crop stage to control sucking pests complex like Aphid, Jassids, Thrips & Whitefly.
Install yellow sticky trap @ 8nos./acre to control & monitor sucking pests complex like Aphid, Jassids, Thrips & Whitefly.
Create drainage channel to drain away excess rain water.

Monitor your field regularly for signs of pest infestation. To prevent sucking pests like aphids and thrips, neem-based pesticide (1500 ppm) may be sprayed @ 3ml/ lit of water.

Plant the seedling at 2.5m x 2.5m distance and 0.5m x 0.5m x 0.5m pit. Disease resistance and Tissue culture seedling should be use. Apply a mixture of topsoil and well rotten FYM in the pit before planting.
